text: The Zettelkasten Method is a personal knowledge management system developed by German sociologist Niklas Luhmann.
Niklas Luhmann published more than 70 books and nearly 400 scholarly articles on various subjects.
Luhmann credited his productivity to his 'slip-box' or Zettelkasten system.
The core principle of the Zettelkasten method is to create atomic notes, each containing a single idea.
Atomic notes in the Zettelkasten method are linked together to form a network of knowledge.
